moves.1. Nf3 d5 2. d4 Nc6 3. e3: nothing special so far - basic development
moves.5... Bg4 6. Be2 Nf6 7. Bd2 O-O: i thought about castling here - but decided to hold off and develop my board a little more
moves.8. b4 a5 9. b5: trying to force the knight back to it's corner
moves.9... Nb8 10. c5: i don't do this too often, but i was going for a good pawn push early (for some reason).  You will find out later on it was the difference in the game/right decision
moves.10... e6 11. h3: got sick of opponent's white bishop sitting there comfortably
moves.11... Bf5 12. Nc3 Be4: decided to take the bishop even though next move i'll most likely have to move knight from f3
moves.14. Ne5: i expected black knight to move from f6 to expose white knight to bishop
moves.16. O-O Bxe5: here's the swap with black getting 1 pt advantage with the extra pawn kill
moves.19... Rd8 20. Rd1: more support added because of the queen/rook threat
moves.20... Qf5 21. Bc3 Nd7 22. c6 bxc6 23. bx: here white makes up for the 1 pt difference
moves.24... Rxd8 25. Bxa5 Nd3 26. Qf1: should have moved queen to d2......this was a bad move by white
moves.31. Qe7 Qd6 32. Qf7+ Kh8 33. Rf6: trying to muscle blacks queen out of the way
moves.34... Rf8 35. Rf7: i didn't want to kill black's rook at this point with the sacrifice
moves.36... Qc1+: i anticipated black's check move - easily defended with pawn protection
moves.37. Kh2 Qc5: black did not kill white pawn if so white queen to f8 = mate
